page.title: 02Crossmichael Church
page.content: The church has 180 members. Fifty or sixty attend every Sunday. There are about a dozen in the Sunday School. The present church, the second on the site, was built in 1751. There are no records of when the previous one was built but the earliest tombstone is in memory of Randolf Ross, who died 10th December 1547. The bell tower of the old church forms part of the new. One of the tombs is of William Graham, a young Covenanter who was shot by a party of Claverhouse's dragoons in 1682, while fleeing from his mother's home at Mollance. Another is of Reverend David Welsh, who was professor of Church History at Edinburgh and in 1843 Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland.
